title: Spiced salmon with pineapple salsa
description: A tropical pineapple salsa pairs up nicely with spicy smoky salmon. You could also use chicken or beef instead of salmon.
ingredients: 6 x 175g wild Alaskan salmon fillets, with skin
4 tbsp sunflower oil, plus extra for brushing
6 large sprigs fresh flatleaf parsley, to garnish

method.Step 1: Make the salsa. Gently heat the sugar, vinegar, sake, saffron and chilli in a medium saucepan. Stir until the sugar dissolves.

method.Step 2: Meanwhile, slice, core and chop the pineapple into small-medium dice. Add to the hot sake mixture, bring to the boil, then set aside.

method.Step 3: In a bowl, mix the paprika, garlic, cumin and cayenne with some salt and pepper. Brush the fish with a little oil and coat in the spice mixture.

method.Step 4: Heat 2 frying pans over a medium-high heat and divide the oil between them. When hot, fry the fish flesh-side down for 3 minutes – the spices should darken but not burn. Turn over and fry for a further 4-5 minutes, until just cooked through.

method.Step 5: Gently reheat the salsa until hot, then remove the chilli. Divide the fish between plates, spoon over the salsa and garnish with parsley to serve.
